Activity: Boot up my workstation, grab a coffee, and check emails for any urgent requests or updates. Skim through industry news on EHR integration - maybe something interesting on Stack Overflow or a relevant blog.
Start drafting a preliminary outline for the EHR system updates. Focus on defining the scope and objectives. What specific data points do we need to capture for the influenza trend analysis?

Email @clinlead-1, @da-1, @his-1 Topic: EHR Data Requirements for Influenza Analysis - Need their input on the essential data elements needed for analysis and any clinical workflows that might be affected by the changes. Attach the preliminary outline.
Research the existing EHR database schema. Identify the tables and fields that currently store relevant patient information (demographics, diagnoses, vaccination records, etc.).
Lunch Break. Grab something quick from the cafeteria and browse Reddit.
Review the responses from @clinlead-1, @da-1, @his-1 regarding data requirements. Start incorporating their feedback into the detailed requirements specifications document.
Focus on defining the specific data types, formats, and validation rules for each data element. Ensure data integrity and consistency.
Document potential data quality issues or gaps in the existing EHR system. Highlight any areas where data cleansing or standardization may be required. @da-1 might have insights.
Continue working on the requirements document. Focus on the technical aspects - APIs, data mapping, and integration points. Save progress and shut down.
